page.title: 05Changing Times - The Village
page.content: There were only four council houses built in 1950-57 until 1983-84 when another two were built across the road from the previous ones in Kirkbank Road. Very recently they have started to build a play area. There used to be a local policeman in the village. He used to go about on a bicycle and knew everyone. In later years he had a van. Ten or twelve years ago he was transferred to Moffat and the village "bobby" no longer existed. Police from Lockerbie and Moffat patrol the A74 day and night and are easily contacted if needed.
